definitions.definition: used in questions to ask the reason for or purpose of something

examples.text: Tell me why you did it.
‘I would like you to go.’ ‘**Why me?**’
**Why oh why** do people keep leaving the door open?

definitions.definition: used in questions to suggest that it is not necessary to do something

examples.text: Why get upset just because you got one bad grade?
Why bother to write? We'll see him tomorrow.

definitions.definition: used to give or talk about a reason

examples.text: That's why I left so early.
I know you did it—I just want to know why.
**The reason why** the injection needs repeating every year is that the virus changes.

definitions.definition: used in questions to mean ‘why’, expressing surprise

examples.text: Why ever didn't you tell us before?

definitions.definition: used to make or agree to a suggestion

wordOrigin: Old English hwī, hwȳ ‘by what cause’, instrumental case of hwæt ‘what’, of Germanic origin.
